events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th, resulting in moderate damage to the car's front bumper and hood.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and confirming it involved a car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the claimant and guide them through the claims process.
The customer received acknowledgement of the claim and was provided with contact details for further assistance.
The agent requested all relevant documents including the police report, repair estimates, and photographs of the damage.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including detailed photos of the car damage and the official police collision report.
An investigation was initiated to verify the circumstances of the accident and assess the extent of damage to the vehicle.
The investigation report was completed confirming the incident and the repair costs were verified by an independent appraiser.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the cost of repairs based on the findings of the investigation and the repair estimates.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the timely handling of the claim.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance company after all terms of the settlement were agreed upon by both parties.
The agreed settlement payment was issued to the claimant's designated bank account to cover the approved auto repair costs.
The claim was officially closed following payment issuance and confirmation that all repair work had been completed satisfactorily.
All case files and documentation related to the completed auto accident claim were archived for future reference.
